intro: Hieracium pseudoauratum, commonly known as the false golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers consist of ray florets that range from yellow to reddish in color. Hieracium pseudoauratum is often considered a weed but can be found in various ecological settings across its native range.
